intro: Isoetes laevis, commonly known as the smooth water fern, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the order Isoetales. It is characterized by its simple, ribbon-like leaves that are often submerged in water. The plant lacks true roots and instead has rhizoids that anchor it to the substrate. Isoetes laevis is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its reproductive structures are borne on specialized stems, and it plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems.
